TaxonIdentification.species_authority: (Boenninghausen ex Reichenbach) Hylander ex Á. Löve & D. Löve

treatment.description: Plants glabrous throughout or sparsely pubescent. Stems (1–)2–10(–18) dm. Cauline leaves: petiole not winged, base auriculate; blade (3–)5–9(–11)-foliolate, (1.5–)2.5–10(–15) cm; lateral leaflets sessile or petiolulate, rachis not winged, blade smaller than terminal; terminal leaflet (or simple blade) suborbicular or oblong, (0.6–)1.5–3.5(–4.5) cm × (4–)8–20(–25) mm, base obtuse, cuneate, or subcordate, margins entire or repand, apex obtuse. Fruiting pedicels divaricate or descending, straight or, occasionally, recurved, (7–)9–21(–25) mm. Flowers: sepals 2.5–4 × 1–1.5 mm; petals white or pink, spatulate or obovate, 4.5–6 × 1.5–3 mm, (base to 1 mm), apex rounded; filaments 2.5–3.5 mm; anthers 0.7–1 mm. Fruits 1.4–2.2(–2.7) cm × 1–1.5(–1.8) mm; ovules 30–38(–40) per ovary; style 0.5–1.5(–2) mm. Seeds uniseriate, reddish brown, ovoid, (0.8–)1–1.2 × (0.6–)0.7–0.8(–0.9) mm, moderately reticulate with (75–)100–150(–175) areolae on each side. 2n = 64.
treatment.global_distribution: introduced also elsewhere in the New World
